course.subject: SOSC
course.name: Quantitative Data Analysis for Social Research I
course.description: This course focuses on practical aspects and implementation of social data analysis by introducing basic yet hands-on techniques for presenting, analyzing, and interpreting quantitative data, many of which are rarely taught in a regular statistics course. It is deliberately designed as complementary to a formal and theoretically-oriented introductory statistics course. This course introduces basic knowledge about quantitative data analysis from a social scientific perspective, from data generating processes to causal inference. Devoted computing sessions, a signature feature of the course, demonstrate hands-on techniques, such as data extraction, data management, variable manipulation, and descriptive analysis. Students will have the chance to implement ideas and methods from the lectures through in-class exercises, as well as a project, by applying what they learn to real-world data. Upon completion of the course, students should have acquired useful skills for social data analysis as well as a better understanding of quantitative social scientific research. Not to be taken by students admitted to BSc Quantitative Social Analysis from 2022-23 and onwards.

reviews.author: I.048S96
reviews.title: Unprepared Course. If you are not a SHSS student, don't waste your time here.
reviews.comment_content:
The course has gone through major shifts in its contents because the course is being offered as a requirement for SHSS students. So the review before 2017-2018 Spring is no longer valid.

The professor kept excusing himself that he's teaching 3 courses this term, but I don't care. The professor was undoubtedly unprepared and didn't seem confident about what he was offering to his students.

I don't think the content is the problem for this course. It teaches basic stuff related to statistics in Social Science Research. Not too technical, but because the professor tries to avoid technical stuff, the course ends up going no where + repetitive.

Stuff like:

Sources of social data
Data Generating Processes
Variables
Data Manipuation
Describing Uni-variate Distribution
Two-way table
Compare distribution between Groups
Scatterplot, Correlation, OLS
Regression Analysis
Causality & Study Design
Hierarchical Data Structure

are taught.
reviews.comment_teaching:
It's just ordinary teaching where he reads the presentation slides. And most of the explanation he provides for the questions are: "That is too hard to understand. Not the scope of this course. You probably haven't heard of ... "

I sent many emails and talked to him lots of times regarding the lack of instructions for assignments and grading rubrics for the project. No matter how many times I tell him about the course, he is not willing to fix those mistakes and make the course student-friendly.
reviews.comment_grading:
Final exam with a weight of 30~40% and 20 Multiple Choice Questions. That is probably enough to explain what the course is like. I discussed this with another professor and he seemed confused as well.

The format of the exam destroys the meaning of the final exam which is to evaluate students' efforts throughout the term.
reviews.comment_workload:
The only good thing about the course. Not much work load. Go to classes and hope you will do great on your final exam, do two assignments, and get into a good group for your project.

If you are not a SHSS student, I am pretty sure there are more math-oriented statistics courses that will help you more.

reviews.author: garbage
reviews.title: ABSOLUTELY GOOD
reviews.comment_content: USEFUL CONTENT AND LEARNING ALL THE R CODES BY FOLLOWING THE TA AND PROFESSOR SINCE THE TA KNOWS ABOUT R AND HE JUST TYPES IN THE CODES WITH ILLUSTRATION.
reviews.comment_teaching:
GOOD.
SEE THE CONTENT SECTION.
reviews.comment_grading:
THE GRADING IS JUST GOOD AF.
FIRST, THE QUIZZES ARE CONDUCTED THROUGH CANVAS AND YOU NEED TO SUBMIT THE R SCRIPT OF R CODES OF THE MULTIPLE CHOICE.
IF YOU DO NOT SUBMIT IT IN 5 MINUTES, YOU WILL BE DEDUCTED 10% OF THE POINTS.
IT IS JUST MARVELOUS SINCE FIRST WE HAVE NOT LEARNT ANYTHING BECAUSE THE QUIZ IS EASY AF AND SECOND HE JUST DEDUCT THE SCORE FOR PROPER REASONS. ANYONE WHO DO NOT KNOW HOW TO DO THE QUIZZES IS A DUMBASS LOL.
reviews.comment_workload:
LIGHT AF.
FIRST, YOU NEED TO LEARN THE EASY R CODES BY YOURSELF BECAUSE THE TA TEACHES BASICALLY EVERYTHING IN CLASS.
SECOND YOU NEED TO SUBMIT A REPORT THAT IS LIGHT AF.
DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE UNLESS YOU WANT TO GET A NICE GRADE AND LEARN A LOT. :)

reviews.author: damn life
reviews.title: 超級無敵垃圾course
reviews.comment_content: 想講呢個course係學d對sosc無用既coding,基本上你tutorial學既係唔會出現係quiz, 成個course 真係設計得好差
reviews.comment_teaching: 個prof連自己講乜都唔知，淨係識得ehh... armm... err...，更遑論個TA，完全無系統教書，仲要大義凜然咁叫你google 搵答案，根本搵唔到
reviews.comment_grading: 唔知！上左半個sem，已經忍唔住黎吐槽，真係好垃圾，根本係自學
reviews.comment_workload: 每個禮拜自學完全無學過既野你話曬唔曬時間，仲要左project

reviews.author: Jingruo chen
reviews.title: Not Recommended
reviews.comment_content:
The content is actually quite a lot. Covers basically most graphs or data types you need to use to do research on Social Science.
However, the whole feeling is like you know their names and a bit of character of each one but understand little.
As for the R, the computing session is terrible, to be honest. I highly recommend anyone who wants to learn R to use videos on Youtube to learn instead of this.
Worst, it requires you to know really a lot about R despite its bad teaching.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Boring for the theoretical classes, basically read out the ppt with limited instructions.
Can not finish the class on time.
However,  Prof.Wang is actually a really nice guy who has quite a lot of patience and pays a lot of attention to this course.
You can tell that he is responsible and willing to answer any questions at any time.
Terrible computing sessions since it does not take the fact that you know nothing at the beginning into consideration. That's actually the fault of the TA.
PLEASE TA DO A BETTER JOB!
Self-teaching to save the grade is the only way out.
reviews.comment_grading:
Not graded yet.
But as the experience of quizzes is such terrible I don't expect to get a high grade.
Also, you will find everyone doing projects paying a lot of effort since it takes 50% of the marks.
reviews.comment_workload:
REEEAALLY A LOTTT
You need to prepare for the quizzes, which means you need to self teach all basic R knowledge.
You need to attend the class because he loves to ask students to answer the questions by reading out their names.
You need to pay a lot of effort on group projects since it decides your grades in a way and there are no limitations for the projects, which means everybody tries to save their grades at the last time.

reviews.author: stephwkt
reviews.comment_content: It might seems easy at first, as the topics are covered in high school math (mean mode median, sd, probit, etc). However, new topics will be introduced after midterm, and there are many new terms. So don't be fooled by the topics at first.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Quite unorganised ppt, it takes some time for you to adapt to his style (always uh uh uh...)
But he will distribute question bank practice question before midterm and final.
reviews.comment_grading: sd very small, students almost full mark (midterm)
reviews.comment_workload:
Acceptable: a few assignments
Class attendance is checked by random picking students from the class list to answer question

reviews.comment_content: 重點係計數，mean mode median sd 簡單，confident intervel, hypothesis ,最難就multiple regression
reviews.comment_teaching: 日本prof 教到1999，英文差之餘，Maths skill 都麻麻，原來佢係social science 出身，想學多D野建議reg Math2411
reviews.comment_grading:
派兩成零A range,只是唔派A+,算好grade,Mean 有B
Midterm >1sd, 其他唔知，最後A
reviews.comment_workload: Present 5mins, hea 做。assignment 簡單，得2份。report 認真做，midterm final 唔算難

reviews.comment_content:
Just need to write some comments per week then can fulfill the 10% attendance
All the content included in the PowerPoint
reviews.comment_teaching: the programming course's quiz focuses on so much the theory and explains the code
reviews.comment_grading:
It's quite easy to follow if you finish the PowerPoint assignment.
The problem sets are easy to get a full and the mean is all around 9x%
The final exam mainly focuses on the quiz done before.
reviews.comment_workload:
4 problem sets, around one set per two weeks
each problem set followed by an in-class quiz

reviews.author: Yves1112
reviews.title: Totally a waste of time
reviews.comment_content:
Just basic R syntax.
Covered some basic functions related to statistics.
reviews.comment_teaching:
This is the first time I evaluate a teacher this low. As you can see in other reviews, this guy never provide the record and answer after the quiz, and he only interprets them by using the following format:

"I THINK YOU SHOULD KNOW THIS, PLEASE GO BACK TO THE PPT", "……OH, THIS ONE IS EASY, THERE IS NO NEED TO TALK ABOUT THIS."

OK, if I knew how to answer I wouldn't make mistakes. It seems he just not trying to fully endow in teaching.

Anyway, if you enrolled in this course then you better try to learn by yourself and frequently contact TA.
reviews.comment_grading:
Based on 7-9 Quizzes, 1 Mid-term and 1 Final.
Given the circumstance that these questions are directly related to the course content,  therefore there is no argument on the answer, it seems transparent.
reviews.comment_workload: To be fair, it's very lite. However, it requires you to demonstrate the learned tricks on your own time. And the time consumption depends on your own pace.

reviews.author: mindy_1207
reviews.comment_content: Stuff about R programming (basic operations and data visualization using the tidy verse package)  and some concepts of quantitative social science research (e.g., methods for sampling). The course follow similar routine every week: specific methods of quantitative research is taught in the first class, and we learn how to apply those methods using R in the second class.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Honestly the course is not taught in the best way. The instructor taught in a clear way, and it's certain that he'd made careful plans for his teaching and had stuck to it. He is also patient, and is always willing to answer questions.
However, as least from my perspective, the correlation between knowledge points was not empathised, which made summarisation and revision a little difficult, and the professor sometimes failed to identify the parts of the contents that are complicated and hard to understand (i.e., he spent quite some time on things that are easy). This made his classes tedious and the learning atmosphere quite inactive.
Another thing that adds to the difficulty in learning is that he didn't give answers to quizzes. It's sometimes disturbing. So try your best not to miss too much things in class.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is fair as far as I'm concerned. There were four quizzes, each weighed 10% and included 10 MC, and a final with 30 MCs which consisted 30% of the total grade. The rest depends on participation. Go to class, answer a couple of questions and you'll have full mark.
reviews.comment_workload: There's no assignment, and the quizzes and test are not extremely hard (and they're also open book). Out of class work is needed, either to memorise the concepts or to get familiar with R.  But I would say that the most important thing is to follow the course. Comparing to the other courses I've taken, this course provides less opportunity for students to catch up.

reviews.author: Toby0628
reviews.comment_content: Rubbish content. Dunno whats going on. Teaches a lot of R studio and programming stuff but not too sure how it functions. Although Rstudio might be useful in the future, it is hard to understand what he was teaching, we have to learn it by ourselves.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Poor teaching
We cannot answer "I don't know" during lessons or else we will have no participation marks.
reviews.comment_grading: Above mean a bit. But the quizzes are straight-forward, although I don't know what's going on.
reviews.comment_workload: have 4 quizzes and one finals. No homework. But participation marks are hard to get.

reviews.author: FatCow
reviews.title: QSA required course
reviews.comment_content: Same with other reviews. Nothing special, one lecture (related to statistic such as regression line, two-way table and panel studies) and one tutorial (related to R) per week.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. is nice, he would like to answer your questions and receive comments on this course. He is trying his best to improve this course. At first, he always asked us to search Google during the quizzes, but later on, his quizzes focused more on what we learned.

For the TA... He should be the first time to teach this course and most of the R notes are copying from the internet (I could find the note from the first search of Google -_-)
reviews.comment_grading:
Remember to answer the questions he asked, or else he will deduct your attendance marks
Btw, it is quite troublesome to upload your Rscript after each quiz, if you cannot submit on time, your quiz may turn out to be 0.

My marks:
quiz 1 10/10
quiz 2 6/10
quiz 3 5/10
quiz 4 8/10
40%

attendance 10/10  
10%

presentation 9.5/10 10%
written report 38/40 (mean 33.8) 40%
Total 50%

Final grade: A-
reviews.comment_workload:
4 quizzes and 1 project
No mid term and no final
Remember to find good group mates (at most 6 ppl), it is better to start the project early since it needs around 30 pages.

reviews.author: 清水灣一號
reviews.comment_content:
One computer session and one lecture per week.
Computer session will cover the usage of R.
Lectures are mostly about handling data and analysing data in different ways.
No mathematics included and is important to understand the concept for each lecture.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The TA was in charge of the computer sessions. His teaching is really bad that nobody can understand what he is doing. The notes were wrong and did not provide methods for students to solve their problems but the TA replied email frequently.
The teaching of lectures was even more worse. There were almost 100 pages in each PowerPoint and every time the professor will only explain around 10-15 pages and skip all other pages for self-reading.
reviews.comment_grading:
Normal grading (not too bad)
The quiz was 80% about computer session and it was difficult as nobody understands what's happening in the computer session but still, the grading is normal.
Quiz: 7/10
7/10
5/10
8/10
Attendance: 10/10
Group project (presentation) :9.5/10
Written group project: 34/30
Grade:B+
reviews.comment_workload:
With 5 quizzes which need to spend much time to understand the usage of R.
Also a group project but it depends.

reviews.author: Ivyyyyyyyy
reviews.comment_content:
You may learn R language.

Attendance is needed. The professor will call your name and ask you questions.
reviews.comment_teaching: The prof explains each PowerPoint slides detailly but the lesson overrun will for around 15 minutes.
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair grading.

I just met or a little bit over the mean and get b range. So, it is fair for the grading.
reviews.comment_workload:
4 MC Quizzes. I didn't put much effort on them can also be graded higher than the mean.

Group project with no more than 6 people. Good groupmates really make you have less workload.

reviews.author: hyhyy
reviews.comment_content: Learning data management skills like locating data source, transforming variables, linking datasets.
reviews.comment_teaching: Tutor haven’t used R studio before but he taught us. Over run in every lesson in saying sth won’t be tested. Professor will ask your name to answer if not he will mark a record then deduct your attendance score.
reviews.comment_grading:
Most ppls in B range.
Questions in quiz were something you haven’t heard from lectures and didn’t search in google. Many error in this course.
reviews.comment_workload:
Have 4 quiz in R.
Half tutorials and half lectures
Project Defense
Project presentation

reviews.author: CRangestudent
reviews.title: SHITTIST COURSE IN HKUST, IF NOT THE ENTIRE WORLD
reviews.comment_content:
SHIT STUFF, GET AWAT WHEN YOU CAN
DONT TAKE UNLESS YOU HAVE TO


HONESTLY IDK HOW THIS GUYS IS STILL HIRED
reviews.comment_teaching:
LOL I DIDNT EXPERIENCE ANY TEACHING

TWO LECTURES PER WEEK, THE TA DOES SOME CRAPP PRESENTATION WITH R ON ONE OF THE LECTURES

DURING THE PROFESSOR'S LECTURE, JUST READ THROUGH PPT WHICH I COULD DO MYSELF
reviews.comment_grading:
RIDICULOUS REASONS FOR MARKS DEDUCTION, NOT HANDING IN CODE IN 5 MINS AFTER THE QUIZ, INTERNET DELAY IS NOT AN EXCUSE.

GIVING OUT QUIZZES AND EXAMS BEFORE TEACHING SHIT
reviews.comment_workload:
SELF STUDY THE COURSE IS YOUR WORKLOAD

THE ONLY GOOD THING IS NO HOMEWORK

4 QUIZZES IN 4 WEEKS IN A ROW

ACCUMULATING TOPICS

reviews.author: Sam_091
reviews.comment_content: 主要係教你用R 然後要求你用R整一份project 出黎
reviews.comment_teaching: 超差，每星期兩堂，就係個TA負責教用R，結果個TA播Youtube就當教左，然後個professor叫果陣就係甘er er er。
reviews.comment_grading: Bad
reviews.comment_workload:
基本上你上堂係冇咩用，好多野你自己上網都可以揾到，所以你要用好多時間去自學。

而工作量坦白説唔算大，四個quiz加一分project。

reviews.author: SHSS rubbish
reviews.title: Easy Course
reviews.comment_content: Basic R technique and social science statistics concept. Useful technique in R studio like plotting graph, regression, plotting table, summarising result.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I haven't attend any lecture so I have no idea about the teaching of Hong Bo Wang.
From the comment from my course mates, the teaching is really boring
reviews.comment_grading:
Very easy to get an A
All my team got A range
reviews.comment_workload:
2 Rstudio assignment
1 Final Exam 20 multiple choice
No midterm
Iprs every lecture and computing session
1 group project and preliminary result presentation 20-30pages
The workload of this course is acceptable

reviews.author: gayau
reviews.title: Do not reg this course if you are not SHSS student
reviews.comment_content:
syllabus轉咗要打R script,唔係以前ustspace啲review講咁輕鬆,數底差都讀到,因為都無數比你計lol,final 20題mc,考1粒鐘,基本上個個去到撞完20題就走
有project要做,題目自己定,揾到人carry就唔洗擔心
reviews.comment_teaching: 照ppt讀,講講吓就話內容太深唔assume大家識,搞到大家乜都唔識
reviews.comment_grading:
Project 40%
Final 20%
Assignment 1+2 10%+10%
Attendance 20%
reviews.comment_workload:
2份assignment, 用R打code出result
每堂都有IPRS, 人到腦唔到都無問題

reviews.author: Cindyyyyyyy
reviews.comment_content: This course mainly introduces you to some basic concepts about statistics. There was demonstration for Excel in the lessons as well.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching of instructor was fair but not very interesting.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading of this course is quite good. The two assignments added up to a total of about 10% which do make a difference because most of the people got high marks.
reviews.comment_workload: There are two assignments in total for this course. The workload is quite low and there are only MC questions in the mid-term examination. There are both MC and long questions in final exam which involves some simple calculation.

reviews.comment_content:
Just a basic statistics
not very useful
just a little bit math
some skills about excel , quite useful
Have attendance (every lesson)
reviews.comment_teaching:
not good / boring
most of the student come to the class for attendence only
you can read the notes by yourself
and there is lecture video for the computer session
reviews.comment_grading:
above mean 1 SD in mid-term
above mean in final
above mean in all assignments
9% out of 10%  attendance marks
final grade is B
reviews.comment_workload:
quite low
just a few assignments
and you can find most of the question on internet

reviews.author: human.mystery
reviews.comment_content: Really straight forward in the beginning (mean mode median, sd and curve area.) IB Math SL covers the stuff. But you need to learn how to use the different tables. After midterm if your not focused, everything is like alien language. Before the midterms you can slack off but after you really need to pay full attention.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Presentation didn't feel that organised to me. Started getting really confused. Strongly suggest using the textbook he said. During midterms and finals revision resources are given out.

If you have any questions, Professor Wang is very open to you finding him. It was pretty helpful. I suggest preparing some specific questions
reviews.comment_grading:
(1) Attendance and class participation: 15% :iPRS system
(2) Assignments: 15%: Mean high
(3) Mid-term exam: 30%
(4) Final exam: 40%

Mean high and SD small for the midterm. Important to get a good grade during the midterm.

Finals: Found it very challenging. Mainly focuses on content after the midterm. Mean much lower than the midterm and the SD was much larger.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload fair amount
Assignment is much trickier than the final and midterm exam. Important to get high grades on assignments. If your stuck find Professor and you can try go to MSC for extra help.

reviews.author: SNORLAX
reviews.title: 數底差都讀得好輕鬆
reviews.comment_content:
starting with basic stuff, like mean, mode, median, standard deviation and normal distribution.

After the mid term, the course focus on statistical inference, t-test, confident interval, etc.

Iprs at the beginning of every lesson.
reviews.comment_teaching:
the professor is quite clear. After a few chapters, we will have a review in class, so many students can follow.

but sometimes you may find mistakes on his supplementary exercises, don't be surprised.
reviews.comment_grading:
mid term: 20 mc questions, one long question
very easy, many students got full mark in long question
mean: 26.x/30 sd: 3.x
I got 29/30

final: 30 mc questions
mean: 18 sd: 4
mine: 25
A-,  i think if you pay some effort on this course, you can get twenty-something out of thirty.

mid term 30%
final 40%
iprs 15%
assignment 15%

This stat course is suitable for those students who have weak mathematical skill
reviews.comment_workload:
Easy Course, Easy Life.
only one assignment per month, three in total.
btw, don't forget to show your steps, and hand in on time.
i got 56/100 for the first assignment(lowest among the class) because of skipping steps and late submission.

No project, no present, no essay.
Most questions in mid term and final are MC.

reviews.author: nickname777
reviews.comment_content:
Simple statistics from high school, such as z-test, t-test and simple regression line.

The iprs session starts sharply in the beginning of the lecture. So, be quick. After the PRS session, it's up to you to whether sleep or leave the class.
reviews.comment_teaching: It's okay..
reviews.comment_grading:
attendance(PRS)-15%
Assignment- 15%
midterm-30%
final - 40%

midterm is usually with high mean, but if you don't make mistake, getting full mark should be easy.

I'm not sure about final yet, I think its mean would be high as well.
reviews.comment_workload:
Only 3 assignments total.
Assignments are manageable with using the lecture notes.

reviews.author: Hong@maths
reviews.title: math course in final sociology course in mid term
reviews.comment_content:
at first we learn easy things mean mode median, but midterm include not so many maths. Instead, social research concept is include.
But final have many maths, people cannot catch up
reviews.comment_teaching:
some said professor speach are 1999
but I think it is ok . A lot of illustration is added
but powerpoint is quite clear that you can skip lectures
reviews.comment_grading:
3 asssignment most people score over 95
midterm mean is high sd is small there may be source
final low mean and sd (because of difficult statistics)

IPRS is taken
reviews.comment_workload: low 3 assignment only, if you are good at maths, lecture are easy to handle

reviews.author: Dreamscometrue
reviews.title: Basic statistical knowledge
reviews.comment_content:
Basic knowledge in statistics, starting with DSE F6 core statistics, then M1 syllabus, at last with hypothesis testing.
Simple linear regression is not covered in the semester as time is not enough.

Statistic is important for all the streams in UST, pay attention to the exclusions.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Wang followed the powerpoint to teach(with quite a number of it skipped and will not be covered in exam). He didn't speak in a really fluent way, but still able to understand.

You may ask him after class, he will be very patient listening to you, and explain clearly (sometimes is needed). You may ask him in putonghua.

You may Send him an email for questions also, he replied quickly and clearly.
reviews.comment_grading:
Fully depends on how much effort you have paid on it. I don't know the grading for the class, but I think it is fair.

10% attendance, he will call names to answer questions, if no one replied, he will mark down something

30% midterm ( mean 25, sd 3)
30% final (mean 17, sd 4)
30% assignment

8x % will give you an A-
97% will ensure you an A+
reviews.comment_workload:
Midterm:
20 MCQs + 1 LQ, not difficult, focus on the extra exercises given by him, that is extremely useful. The lq is similar to one of those in the assignment.
Time allowed for it is more than enough, may people sit for 30-45 minutes
I remember about 5 students got full mark

Final:
30 MCQs, not really difficult for calculations, but hard for concept ones. Again, do at least twice for his exercises, helpful, but not as that as Midterm

Assignments: all LQs, some are difficult, including extra bonus questions. Questions come from different textbooks( including the required one)

reviews.author: chimz
reviews.comment_content: content is general. To start with S6 Math Core Statistics part. Then Probability and so on. Not too difficult, but require huge efforts to understand new terms. In later times, e.g. binomial probability: study of proofs is needed. If you are not familiar with studying proofs, you could still give it a go. Because the proof is not too difficult.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Do more proof in later part, i.e. binomial probability, inference

TA (Bill) Did not answer your own question in a direct way, esp Homework
reviews.comment_grading:
general, mean is really high, s.d. is really large, standard score is really small. Most people likely cramped in B range. But the grading is not too bad.

mid-term exam:
mean = median = 25/30
s.d. 3.06

final exam:
mean = median =18/30
s.d. 4.6

Your effort is directly proportional to your grade. Remember grab a glance of your homework before the exam. LQ is similar to the assignment.

My case:
midterm = mean
final = +0.7s.d.
--> final grade: B
reviews.comment_workload:
3 take  home individual assignments (10% x3)
1 Midterm exam (30%)
1 final exam (30%)
Participation (10%)

study group is important for this course. As there are lots of examples in textbook. Read before lesson. Listening to the instructor does not really help much.

reviews.comment_content:
教D好基本既stat.
都係背左d formula, 對表咁
冇咩特別
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof.係日本人, D英文唔多準,但係都叫聽得明既...
教書OK既,唔會話聽完都唔知佢講咩,不過就唔係話好有趣咁
reviews.comment_grading:
個course第一堂就講明冇A+
同埋佢第一堂會講上年派grade既percentage
個percentage都可信既,事實真係幾好grade

(同埋佢有provide past paper, mid-term同final同past paper好似, 基本上你有溫份past paper成績唔會差得去邊)
reviews.comment_workload:
mid term + 2份assignment + group presentation + final
好似好多咁
但係2份assignment都只係幾條題目,好快做完
presentation都唔難,只係用佢比既data睇下有冇correlation咁

reviews.author: gorgeouspig
reviews.title: very good grades for beginners
reviews.comment_content:
Basically about statistics...
You will find it very useful in later studies but exams do not require you to use the notes or pay careful attention to what he said in the class.
Something about big data, data structure and so on...
For social science research purpose.
It is quite important though.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Not so entertaining...
But tolerable.
He is a good and patient teacher who seldom get angry because everyone is chatting online or doing their own business...
But sometimes we do overstep his border since we are like messing around in the classroom...
Show some respect to him (especially kids who are going to start their QSA career). Cuz he is really easy to get along with and answer all kinds of shitty questions that you may ask. I think he was young once before as he tried to attract the class's attention with some of the pop stuff but still failed.
I like him. Really nice professor with a relevant major background.
ABOUT THE TA... TRY YOUR BEST TO CATCH UP WITH HIM ! YOU WILL FACE THE CONSEQUENCE OF YOUR ABSENCE!!!
reviews.comment_grading:
4 online quizzes --- 40% (scheduled date)
All about R techniques.

attendance --- 10% (based on iprs)
some may remote sign in but he never seemed to notice the huge difference of number between sign in-ed people and people who are actually in the class.

group project --- 50% (final presentation 10% + final report 40%)
FIND A GOOD TEAMMATE!
FIND A GROUP OF GOOD TEAMMATE!
It requires a lot of work. (TEAMWORK)
But if you are confident enough to handle everything on tour own, you can give it a try. Don't make yourself ended up falling down the mushroom : )
reviews.comment_workload:
Stressing term but it is not so hard for this course.
Just pay good attention to what TA said about using R.
4 quizzes include questions like the function of some functions (this sounds weird) and using given data set to calculate mean or median or some other measurement. Whatever. Not so hard. If you really devote yourself, you will do a good job. As you can learn R with some resources online by yourself.
The project... Choose those data set that is easy to obtain!
REMEMBER you are a beginner!
You can contact him every time class ends. or write emails.
He responds quickly.

reviews.author: ilovesosc
reviews.title: 幾輕鬆course
reviews.comment_content:
Basic statistic
and basic programming using R to analysis the data
dont expect you will learn too much except R is really useful
attendance is required and marks will be ducted for any missing lesson
reviews.comment_teaching:
the teaching of lecture is a little bit boring because is easy
he always so mean to students because we seems not listening to him and just wait for IPRS
one of the TA teaching R are very quick and you cant miss any point or you will get lost
reviews.comment_grading: A really good grade course in CC for SA
reviews.comment_workload:
not much
just a little bit in R assignment and the final project

reviews.author: kamkin
reviews.title: 超好grade course
reviews.comment_content: The content is rather realistic and easy, which includes the basic statistics and calculation, for instance sd, t-test, P-value and sampling distribution. The content delivered in the lecture is rather realistic and practical. For me, it provides tools for me to analyze the data of midterm and final results released in other courses.
reviews.comment_teaching: The lecturer is very kind to help students and he lays great stress on the concept, which is conducive to our learning.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is great. Although the cut-off score is rather high on account of the performance of the student, the questions in the exams and midterm are manageable. Many students get B+ or even A range grading.

利申A+
reviews.comment_workload: 3 relaxing assignments, midterm and final exam. The workload is satisfactory and light.
